Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two different habitats, one on land and one in water.
The student can include and label different types of plants and animals in the land habitat, such as trees, grasses, and squirrels.
The student can include and label different types of plants and animals in the water habitat, such as fish, clams, and aquatic plants.
The student can show and compare the different types of living things found in each habitat.
The student can use their drawings to demonstrate how certain plants and animals are specific to the type of habitat they live in.
The student can identify patterns in the diversity of plants and animals between the two habitats, based on their drawings.
